SEARCH
Package sh.brane.kzg

Class CKzg

java.lang.Object
sh.brane.kzg.CKzg
All Implemented Interfaces:
Kzg
public final class CKzg extends Object implements Kzg
KZG implementation using the c-kzg-4844 native library.

This class wraps the CKZG4844JNI native bindings to provide KZG commitment operations for EIP-4844 blob transactions. A trusted setup must be loaded before using any cryptographic operations.

Global State Warning

Important: The c-kzg-4844 native library maintains a single global trusted setup shared across all CKzg instances within the JVM. This has several implications:

  • Multiple calls to loadFromClasspath() or loadTrustedSetup(String) will reload the global trusted setup, affecting all existing instances
  • There is no per-instance state; all instances operate on the same native setup
  • In tests, loading a different trusted setup will affect all code using KZG
  • For typical applications, load the trusted setup once at startup and reuse the instance throughout the application lifecycle

Usage Example


 // Load from classpath (recommended) - do this once at startup
 Kzg kzg = CKzg.loadFromClasspath();

 // Or load from a custom path
 Kzg kzg = CKzg.loadTrustedSetup("/path/to/trusted_setup.txt");

 // Use for blob operations
 KzgCommitment commitment = kzg.blobToCommitment(blob);
 KzgProof proof = kzg.computeProof(blob, commitment);
 boolean valid = kzg.verifyBlobKzgProof(blob, commitment, proof);

Thread Safety

This class is thread-safe. The underlying c-kzg-4844 library uses a single global trusted setup which is initialized once. All KZG operations can be called concurrently from multiple threads. The native library handles synchronization internally.

Resource Management

The native library and trusted setup are loaded once and remain in memory for the lifetime of the JVM. There is no need to explicitly free resources, but CKZG4844JNI.freeTrustedSetup() can be called if needed before loading a different setup.

Since:
0.2.0

  • Method Details

    • loadFromClasspath

      public static Kzg loadFromClasspath()
      Loads the trusted setup from the bundled classpath resource.

      This method loads the Ethereum mainnet trusted setup file that is bundled with the brane-kzg module. This is the recommended way to initialize KZG for production use.

      Returns:
      a new Kzg instance
      Throws:
      KzgException - with kind SETUP_ERROR if the native library cannot be loaded or the trusted setup cannot be initialized

    • loadTrustedSetup

      public static Kzg loadTrustedSetup(String path)
      Loads the trusted setup from a file path.

      This method loads a custom trusted setup file. Use this for testing with alternative setups or when the bundled setup is not appropriate.

      Parameters:
      path - the path to the trusted setup file
      Returns:
      a new Kzg instance
      Throws:
      KzgException - with kind SETUP_ERROR if the native library cannot be loaded or the trusted setup file cannot be read
      NullPointerException - if path is null

    • blobToCommitment

      public KzgCommitment blobToCommitment(Blob blob)
      Description copied from interface: Kzg
      Computes a KZG commitment for the given blob.

      The commitment is a 48-byte compressed G1 point on the BLS12-381 curve that uniquely represents the blob data.

      Specified by:
      blobToCommitment in interface Kzg
      Parameters:
      blob - the blob to commit to
      Returns:
      the KZG commitment for the blob

    • computeProof

      public KzgProof computeProof(Blob blob, KzgCommitment commitment)
      Description copied from interface: Kzg
      Computes a KZG proof for the given blob and commitment.

      The proof enables verification that the blob corresponds to the given commitment without requiring the full blob data.

      Specified by:
      computeProof in interface Kzg
      Parameters:
      blob - the blob data
      commitment - the KZG commitment for the blob
      Returns:
      the KZG proof

    • verifyBlobKzgProof

      public boolean verifyBlobKzgProof(Blob blob, KzgCommitment commitment, KzgProof proof)
      Description copied from interface: Kzg
      Verifies that a KZG proof is valid for the given blob and commitment.

      This method checks that the proof correctly proves the blob data corresponds to the given commitment.

      Specified by:
      verifyBlobKzgProof in interface Kzg
      Parameters:
      blob - the blob data
      commitment - the KZG commitment
      proof - the KZG proof to verify
      Returns:
      true if the proof is valid, false otherwise

    • verifyBlobKzgProofBatch

      public boolean verifyBlobKzgProofBatch(List<Blob> blobs, List<KzgCommitment> commitments, List<KzgProof> proofs)
      Description copied from interface: Kzg
      Verifies multiple blob-commitment-proof tuples in a batch.

      This method is more efficient than verifying each tuple individually when multiple blobs need to be verified.

      Specified by:
      verifyBlobKzgProofBatch in interface Kzg
      Parameters:
      blobs - the blob data
      commitments - the KZG commitments
      proofs - the KZG proofs
      Returns:
      true if all proofs are valid, false if any is invalid
